summary: Internal email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding the review of the Epstein case file from the Southern District of Florida. It discusses logistical efforts to meet pretrial disclosure deadlines by recruiting paralegals and an intern to review approximately 30,000 documents.

persons.name: Darcy
persons.context: Mentioned as the source from whom additional paralegals have been requested to assist with the document review.

events.title: Maxwell Review Planning
events.description: Internal email discussion about organizing a review of the SDFL Epstein file to meet pretrial disclosure deadlines.

events.title: Epstein File Scanning
events.description: A vendor was paid to scan the Southern District of Florida (SDFL) Epstein file.

events.title: Pretrial Disclosure Deadline
events.description: Deadline for reviewing the Epstein file to determine what has already been produced.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York is reviewing the Epstein case file from the Southern District of Florida, which contains approximately 30,000 documents.
A team of 4 paralegals, an intern, and an additional 3-4 paralegals requested from 'Darcy' is being assembled to conduct the review to meet pretrial disclosure deadlines by the end of April 2021.
The document scanning was completed in October, with plans to load the files into Relativity by the end of March 2021.
The email is from the Deputy Chief of the Public Corruption Unit at the U.S. Attorney's Office Southern District of New York, indicating high-level oversight of the review process.
